Bernadette Rebienot.label: International Council of 13 Indigenous Grandmothers
Bernadette Rebienot.description: The International Council of 13 Indigenous Grandmothers is an international alliance of indigenous female elders that focuses on issues such as the environment, internationalism, and human rights. Wikipedia

Alexander Berzin (scholar).label: Alexander Berzin
Alexander Berzin (scholar).description: Alexander Berzin is a scholar, translator, and teacher of Tibetan Buddhism. Wikipedia

Brad Warner.label: Brad Warner
Brad Warner.description: Brad Warner is an American Sōtō Zen priest, author, blogger, documentarian and punk rock bass guitarist. Wikipedia

Edwin Otway Burnham.label: Edwin Otway Burnham
Edwin Otway Burnham.description:
Rev Edwin Otway Burnham was a Congregational minister and missionary.
He was born in Ghent, Kentucky, his father died when he was 5 and his mother died the following year. Wikipedia
Edwin Otway Burnham.Died: August 1, 1873, Los Angeles, California, United States

Kurt Kankan Spellmeyer.label: Kurt Kankan Spellmeyer
Kurt Kankan Spellmeyer.description:
Kurt Spellmeyer is a Zen teacher and professor in the English Department at Rutgers University.
Zen Lineage
Kurt Spellmeyer, Kankan Roshi, Trained with Takabayashi Genki and Kangan Glenn Webb, founders of the Seattle Zen Center. Wikipedia

Matthieu Ricard.label: Matthieu Ricard
Matthieu Ricard.description:
Matthieu Ricard is a French Buddhist monk who resides at Shechen Tennyi Dargyeling Monastery in Nepal.
Born in Aix-les-Bains, Savoie, France, he is the son of the late Jean-François Revel, a renowned French philosopher. Wikipedia
Movies: Brilliant Moon Glimpses of Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche

Lu Sheng-yen.label: Lu Sheng-yen
Lu Sheng-yen.description: Lu Sheng-Yen, commonly referred to by followers as Grand Master Lu is the founder and spiritual leader of the True Buddha School, a new Buddhist sect with teachings taken from Sutrayana and Vajrayana, as well as Taoism. Wikipedia

Ali al-Sistani.label: Ali al-Sistani
Ali al-Sistani.description: Ali al-Husayni al-Sistani is the highest-ranking Shia marja in Iraq and the leader of the Hawza of Najaf. Wikipedia

Muhammad Suleman Taunsvi.label: Muhammad Suleman Taunsvi
Muhammad Suleman Taunsvi.description: Muhammad Suleman Taunsvi was a Sufi saint born to the Jafar Pakhtun tribe of Darug, Loralai District, Balochistan province, in what is now Pakistan. His dargah lies in Tehsil Taunsa of district Dera Ghazi Khan of Punjab province in Pakistan. Wikipedia

Syed Ameen Badasha.label: Syed Ameen Badasha
Syed Ameen Badasha.description: Hazrath Syed Ameen Badasha also known as Khwaja e Guntur, was a renowned Muslim Sufi, saint and scholar of the Quadri, Chisti order from Indian sub continent. Wikipedia

Theotonius Amal Ganguly.label: Theotonius Amal Ganguly
Theotonius Amal Ganguly.description: Theotonious Amal Ganguly, C.S.C. {born 18 January 1920, Hashnabad, East Bengal, India } was Archbishop of the Archdiocese of Dhaka from 1967 until his death on 2 September 1977. Archbishop Ganguly was a religious of the Congregation of Holy Cross. Wikipedia

Tripurari Swami.label: Tripurari Swami
Tripurari Swami.description: Tripurari Swami, also known as Swami B.V. Tripurari and Swami Tripurari, is "an author, poet and guru. As a prominent master in the Gaudiya Vaishnava lineage, he is one of the leading practitioners of Bhakti-yoga in the West." Wikipedia
Tripurari Swami.Born: March 12, 1949 (age 65), Teaneck, New Jersey, United States

Wu Kwang.label: Wu Kwang
Wu Kwang.description: Wu Kwang Soen Sa Nim, born Richard Shrobe, is head Zen teacher at Chogye International Zen Center of New York, a practice center of the Kwan Um School of Zen. Before coming to Zen practice Richard studied Hinduism under Swami Satchidananda. Wikipedia

Ajahn Sucitto.label: Ajahn Sucitto
Ajahn Sucitto.description: Ajahn Sucitto is a British-born Theravada Buddhist monk. He is, since 1992, the abbot of Cittaviveka, Chithurst Buddhist Monastery. He was born in London, and was ordained in Thailand in March 1976. Wikipedia

Achan Sobin S. Namto.label: Achan Sobin S. Namto
Achan Sobin S. Namto.description: Achan Sobin S. Namto is a Buddhist monk who has taught Vipassana meditation and Buddhist psychology in Southeast Asia and North America for over 50 years. Wikipedia

Ayya Khema.label: Ayya Khema
Ayya Khema.description: Ayya Khema, a Buddhist teacher, was born as Ilse Kussel in Berlin, Germany, to Jewish parents. Khema escaped Nazis persecution during World War II. She eventually moved to the United States. Wikipedia

Ali Naqi Naqvi.label: Ali Naqi Naqvi
Ali Naqi Naqvi.description: Ayatollah Sayyed Ali Naqi Naqvi, also known as Naqqan, was a mujtahid from Lucknow, India who graduated from Najaf, Iraq. He is famous for his writings in Urdu, including the most famous Shaheed-e-Insaniyat and Tareekh-e-Islam. Wikipedia

Herbert Edward Ryle.label: Herbert Edward Ryle
Herbert Edward Ryle.description: Herbert Edward Ryle KCVO was an author, Old Testament scholar and the Dean of Westminster. Wikipedia

Eliseo Soriano.label: Eliseo Soriano
Eliseo Soriano.description: Eliseo Fernando "Bro. Eli" Soriano is a Filipino televangelist. He is the current Presiding Minister of the Philippines-based Christian organization Members Church of God International, colloquially ... Wikipedia

Kyozan Joshu Sasaki.label: Kyozan Joshu Sasaki
Kyozan Joshu Sasaki.description: Kyozan Joshu Sasaki, Roshi is a Japanese Rinzai Zen teacher who has lived in the United States since 1962. Wikipedia

Migettuwatte Gunananda Thera.label: Migettuwatte Gunananda Thera
Migettuwatte Gunananda Thera.description: Migettuwatte Gunananda Thera or Mohottiwatte Gunananda Thera was a Sri Lankan Buddhist orator. He is known for leading the Buddhist side in debates that occurred between the Buddhists and the Christians ... Wikipedia

Nyanatiloka.label: Nyanatiloka
Nyanatiloka.description: Nyanatiloka Mahathera, born as Anton Gueth, was one of the earliest westerners in modern times to become a Bhikkhu, a fully ordained Buddhist monk. Wikipedia

Sheikh Mohamad Osseiran.label: Sheikh Mohamad Osseiran
Sheikh Mohamad Osseiran.description: Sheikh Mohamad Osseiran is the Jaafari mufti of Saida and Zahrani districts of South Lebanon, Lebanon. Sheikh Osseiran is famous as a highly moderate Shi'a-Muslim Lebanese politician who focuses much of his efforts on interfaith dialogue. Wikipedia

Robina Courtin.label: Robina Courtin
Robina Courtin.description: Robina Courtin, is a Buddhist nun in the Tibetan Buddhist Gelugpa tradition and lineage of Lama Thubten Yeshe and Lama Zopa Rinpoche. In 1996 she founded Liberation Prison Project, which she ran until 2009. Wikipedia

Thanissaro Bhikkhu.label: Thanissaro Bhikkhu
Thanissaro Bhikkhu.description: Ṭhānissaro Bhikkhu, also known as Ajaan Geoff, is an American Theravada Buddhist monk of the Dhammayut Order, Thai forest kammatthana tradition. He is currently the abbot of Metta Forest Monastery in San Diego County. Wikipedia

U Pandita.label: U Pandita
U Pandita.description: Sayadaw U Pandita is one of the foremost living masters of Vipassana meditation. He trained in the Burmese Theravada Buddhist tradition. Wikipedia

Phrabhavanaviriyakhun.label: Phrabhavanaviriyakhun
Phrabhavanaviriyakhun.description: Phrabhavanaviriyakhun is a Thai Buddhist monk. Born in 1941 in Kanchanaburi, Thailand, he followed secular education to post-graduate level. Wikipedia

Shahab al-Din Suhrawardi.label: Shahab al-Din Suhrawardi
Shahab al-Din Suhrawardi.description: "Shahāb ad-Dīn" Yahya ibn Habash as-Suhrawardī was a Persian philosopher, a Sufi and founder of Illuminationism, an important school in Islamic mysticism that drew upon Zoroastrian and Platonic ideas. Wikipedia

Dao Zheng.label: Dao Zheng
Dao Zheng.description: Dao Zheng was a Buddhist nun from Taiwan, known for her various writings and dharma talks. Dao Zheng is well known for her famous painting of Amitabha, which she painted while bedridden with cancer. Wikipedia

Joko Beck.label: Joko Beck
Joko Beck.description: Charlotte Joko Beck was an American Zen teacher and the author of the books Everyday Zen Love and Work and Nothing Special Living Zen. Wikipedia

Tetsugen Doko.label: Tetsugen Doko
Tetsugen Doko.description:
Tetsugen Dōkō was a Japanese Zen Master, and an important early leader of the Ōbaku school of Buddhism.
Tetsugen was born in the seventh year of the Kan'ei era in Higo Province. He became a priest of the Jodo Shinshu sect at the age of 13. Wikipedia

Tulku Urgyen Rinpoche.label: Tulku Urgyen Rinpoche
Tulku Urgyen Rinpoche.description: Tulku Urgyen Rinpoche. A contemporary Buddhist master of the Kagyü and Nyingma lineages, who lived at Nagi Gompa hermitage in Nepal, Urgyen Rinpoche was considered one of the greatest Dzogchen masters of our time. Wikipedia

Imakita Kosen.label: Imakita Kosen
Imakita Kosen.description:
Imakita Kōsen was a Japanese Rinzai Zen rōshi and Neo-Confucianist.
Kosen did his Zen training under Daisetsu Shoen at Sōkoku-ji and received inka from Gisan Zenkai at Sōgen-ji in Okayama. Wikipedia

Lal Shahbaz Qalandar.label: Lal Shahbaz Qalandar
Lal Shahbaz Qalandar.description:
Syed Usman Marwandi also known as Hazrat Lal Shahbaz Qalandar, Sayed sufi saint, philosopher, poet, and qalandar, born as Syed Hussain Shah, he belonged to the Suhrawardiyya order of Sufis.
He preached religious tolerance among Muslims and Hindus. Wikipedia

Channa (Buddhist).label: Channa
Channa (Buddhist).description: Channa - The Divine Charioteer was a royal servant and head charioteer of Prince Siddhartha, who was to become the Buddha. Channa later became a disciple of the Buddha and achieved arahantship, as is described in the 78th verse of the Dhammapada. Wikipedia

Ben Klassen.label: Ben Klassen
Ben Klassen.description: Bernhardt "Ben" Klassen was a self-described White supremacist and an American religious leader who founded the Church of the Creator with the publication of his book Nature's Eternal Religion in 1973. Wikipedia
Ben Klassen.Died: August 6, 1993, Otto, North Carolina, United States

Hsin Ting.label: Hsin Ting
Hsin Ting.description: Hsin Ting is a Buddhist monk from Taiwan who served as the sixth-term abbot and director of Fo Guang Shan from 1997 to 2005. He served as acting abbot for three years after the sudden death of his predecessor, the Venerable Hsin Ping, in 1995. Wikipedia

Hongzhi Zhengjue.label: Hongzhi Zhengjue
Hongzhi Zhengjue.description: Hongzhi Zhengjue, also sometimes called Tiantong Zhenjue, was a Chinese Chan Buddhist monk who authored or compiled several influential Buddhist texts. Wikipedia

Hu Songshan.label: Hu Songshan
Hu Songshan.description: Hu Songshan, a Hui, was born in 1880, in Tongxin County, Ningxia, China. His Muslim name in Arabic was Sa'd al-Din simplified Chinese 赛尔敦丁; traditional Chinese 賽爾敦丁; pinyin sài ěr dūn dīng). Wikipedia

Dilgo Khyentse.label: Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche
Dilgo Khyentse.description: Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche was a Vajrayana master, scholar, poet, teacher, and head of the Nyingma school of Tibetan Buddhism from 1987 to 1991. Wikipedia

Reza Hosseini Nassab.label: Reza Hosseini Nassab
Reza Hosseini Nassab.description: Grand Ayatollah Seyed Reza Hosseini Nassab is an Iranian Twelver Shi'a Marja, currently residing in Canada. Wikipedia

Sakyong Mipham.label: Sakyong Mipham
Sakyong Mipham.description: Sakyong Jamgon Mipham Rinpoche, Jampal Trinley Dradul is the head of the Shambhala Buddhist lineage and Shambhala International, a worldwide network of urban Buddhist meditation centers, retreat centers, ... Wikipedia
Movies: Crazy Wisdom The Life & Times of Chogyam Trungpa Rinpoche

Tampalawela Dhammaratana.label: Tampalawela Dhammaratana
Tampalawela Dhammaratana.description: Ven. Dr. Tampalawela Dhammaratana, French and Sri Lankan national, was born in Sri Lanka and received his traditional Buddhist education from Sangharaja Pirivena in Kandy and Sunetradevi University College. Wikipedia

Heng Sure.label: Heng Sure
Heng Sure.description: Heng Sure is an American Buddhist monk, born and ordained in the United States. He is a senior disciple of the late Venerable Master Hsuan Hua, and is currently the director of the Berkeley Buddhist ... Wikipedia

Trungram Gyaltrul Rinpoche.label: Trungram Gyaltrul Rinpoche
Trungram Gyaltrul Rinpoche.description:
Trungram Gyaltrul
A line of tulkus of the Karma Kagyu school of Tibetan Buddhism.
The 4th Trungram Gyaltrul, also Drungram Gyaltrul, Tenpa Gyaltsen, and Gyalwa Lama, was born into a Nepalese Sherpa ... Wikipedia

Suzuki Shōsan.label: Suzuki Shōsan
Suzuki Shōsan.description: Suzuki Shōsan was a Japanese samurai who served under the Shogun Tokugawa Ieyasu. Shōsan was born in modern-day Aichi Prefecture of Japan. Wikipedia

Wuzhun Shifan.label: Wuzhun Shifan
Wuzhun Shifan.description: Wuzhun Shifan was a Chinese painter, calligrapher, and prominent Zen Buddhist monk who lived during the late Song Dynasty. Wikipedia

Nonin Chowaney.label: Nonin Chowaney
Nonin Chowaney.description: Rev. Nonin Chowaney is an American Soto Zen priest, brush calligrapher, and the current abbot and head priest of the Nebraska Zen Center at the Heartland Temple in Omaha, Nebraska. Wikipedia

Addai II Giwargis.label: Addai II Giwargis
Addai II Giwargis.description: Mar Addai II, born Shimun Giwargis, is the incumbent Catholicos Patriarch of the Ancient Church of the East and resides in the Apostolic See of Seleucia-Ctesiphon in Baghdad, Iraq. Wikipedia

Radhanath Swami.label: Radhanath Swami
Radhanath Swami.description: Radhanath Swami is a Gaudiya Vaishnava guru. He works largely from Mumbai in India and also travels extensively throughout Europe and America. He has been instrumental in the founding of the Bhaktivedanta hospital in Mumbai. Wikipedia

Nanda (Buddhist nun).label: Nanda
Nanda (Buddhist nun).description: Princess Sundari Nanda was the half-sister of Siddhartha Gautama, who later became Gautama Buddha. She became a nun after the enlightenment of her half-brother and became the foremost bhikkhuni in the practise of jhana. Wikipedia

Kobun Chino Otogawa.label: Kobun Chino Otogawa
Kobun Chino Otogawa.description: Kobun Otogawa was a Sōtō Zen priest. Wikipedia

Danxia Zichun.label: Danxia Zichun
Danxia Zichun.description: Danxia Zichun, was a Zen Buddhist monk during the Song Dynasty. He was born in a city called Zitong, which is in modern Sichuan Province. He is buried in south of Mt Hong near the modern city of Wuhan. Wikipedia

Mya Thwin.label: Mya Thwin
Mya Thwin.description: Mya Thwin, known as Mother Sayamagyi is a Theravada Buddhist teacher who has established centers for vipassana meditation around the world. Wikipedia

Yadunandana Swami.label: Yadunandana Swami
Yadunandana Swami.description: Yadunandana Swami, Principal of Bhaktivedanta College, is the first Spanish second generation sannyasi of ISKCON. He was approved by ISKCON’s GBC body, in February 2009, as an ISKCON sannyasa. Wikipedia

Bodhin Kjolhede.label: Bodhin Kjolhede
Bodhin Kjolhede.description: Bodhin Kjolhede is a Sōtō/Rinzai Zen roshi and Abbot of the Rochester Zen Center, a position he assumed when Philip Kapleau retired from teaching in 1986. He was ordained as a priest in 1976 and received Dharma transmission in 1986. Wikipedia

Chang Sik Kim.label: Chang Sik Kim
Chang Sik Kim.description: Chang Sik Kim was born in South Korea in 1944. When he was thirteen he met his teacher, Seung Sahn Lee, and entered the Hwa Gye temple in Seoul. When Kim was 21, his teacher sent him on a 100 day meditation retreat. Wikipedia

Wangdrak Rinpoche.label: Wangdrak Rinpoche
Wangdrak Rinpoche.description:
Wangdrak Rinpoche is the abbot of Gebchak Gonpa, holding responsibility for the nuns' spiritual training and their material well-being.
Wangdrak Rinpoche the third is the reincarnation of Wangdrak Dorje. Wikipedia

Ngawang Jigdral Rinpoche.label: Ngawang Jigdral Rinpoche
Ngawang Jigdral Rinpoche.description:
Ngawang Jigdral Rinpoche, known as Pemba Sherpa, is a Nyingma tulku and said to be the 3rd reincarnation of Gomchen Rinpoche.
From an early age he joined Himalaya Sherpa Buddhist School in Nepal where he learned basic Buddhist and secular studies. Wikipedia

Hanumatpresaka Swami.label: Hanumatpresaka Swami
Hanumatpresaka Swami.description: Hanumatpresaka Swami is a Gaudiya Vaishnava guru and a spiritual leader for the International Society for Krishna Consciousness. He is known as a Vaishnava scholar, continuously traveling, lecturing on classical Indian literature and philosophy. Wikipedia

Baba Faqir Chand.label: Baba Faqir Chand
Baba Faqir Chand.description: Baba Faqir Chand, was an Indian master of Surat Shabd Yoga, or consciously controlled near death experience. Wikipedia

Dada Lekhraj.label: Dada Lekhraj
Dada Lekhraj.description: Lekhraj Khubchand Kripalani, also known as Dada Lekhraj, was the founder of the Brahma Kumaris. He is also known as Brahma Baba by the members of the Brahma Kumaris. Wikipedia

Juan de Velasco.label: Juan de Velasco
Juan de Velasco.description: Juan de Velasco y Pérez Petroche was an 18th-century Jesuit priest, historian, and professor of philosophy and theology from the Royal Audience of Quito. He was born in Riobamba to Juan de Velasco y López de Moncayo and to María Pérez Petroche. Wikipedia

Mohammad Hussein Fadlallah.label: Mohammad Hussein Fadlallah
Mohammad Hussein Fadlallah.description:
Grand Ayatollah Muhammad Hussein Fadl-Allāh was a prominent Lebanese Twelver marja.
From a Lebanese family, but born in Najaf, Iraq, Fadlallah studied Islamic sciences in Najaf before moving to Lebanon in 1952. Wikipedia

Kirpal Singh.label: Kirpal Singh
Kirpal Singh.description:
Kirpal Singh was a spiritual Master.
He was born in India, in a simple rural house, in the western part of Punjab which now belongs to Pakistan. Wikipedia

Nisshō.label: Nisshō
Nisshō.description: Nisshō was a Buddhist disciple of Nichiren and the uncle of Nichirō. He was the only disciple who was actually older than Nichiren himself. Wikipedia

Vidyaranya.label: Vidyaranya
Vidyaranya.description: Vidyāraṇya also known as Mādhava Vidyāranya is variously known as being a kingmaker, patron saint and high priest to Harihara Raya I and Bukka Raya I, the founders of the Vijayanagar Empire. Wikipedia
Books: Sankara-dig-vijaya The Traditional Life of Sri Sankaracharya
The Sarva-Darsana-Samgraha Or Review of the Different Systems of Hindu PhilosophyMore

Thomas Folan.label: Thomas Folan
Thomas Folan.description: Very Rev. Fr. Thomas D Folan, 1810 - 1874, King of the Claddagh. Wikipedia

Abe no Seimei.label: Abe no Seimei
Abe no Seimei.description: Abe no Seimei was an onmyōji, a leading specialist of onmyōdō during the middle of the Heian Period in Japan. Wikipedia

Arnold Resnicoff.label: Arnold Resnicoff
Arnold Resnicoff.description: Arnold E. Resnicoff is an American Conservative rabbi who served as a military officer and military chaplain. He served in Vietnam and Europe before attending rabbinical school. He then served as a U.S. Navy Chaplain for almost 25 years. Wikipedia

Eido Tai Shimano.label: Eido Tai Shimano
Eido Tai Shimano.description: Eido Tai Shimano is a Rinzai Zen Buddhist roshi. He was the founding abbot of the New York Zendo Shobo-Ji in Manhattan and Dai Bosatsu Zendo Kongo-Ji monastery in the Catskill mountains of New York; he ... Wikipedia

Akhtar Raza Khan.label: Akhtar Raza Khan
Akhtar Raza Khan.description: Akhtar Raza Khan is an Islamic jurist, born on Tuesday 2 February 1943 in the district of Saudagran in the city of Bareilly, India. The name given during his Aqeeqah was Muhammad. He was also given the name Muhammad Ismail Raza. Wikipedia

Fenggan.label: Fenggan
Fenggan.description: Fenggan was a Chinese Zen monk-poet lived in the Tang Dynasty, associated with Hanshan and Shide in the famed "Tiantai Trio". Wikipedia

Felix Manalo.label: Felix Manalo
Felix Manalo.description: Felix Ysagun Manalo, also known as Ka Félix, was the founder and first Executive Minister of the Philippines'-based religious organization Iglesia ni Cristo, and incorporated it with the Philippine Government on July 27, 1914. Wikipedia

Hakuun Yasutani.label: Haku'un Yasutani
Hakuun Yasutani.description: Hakuun Yasutani was a Sōtō Rōshi, the founder of the Sanbo Kyodan Zen Buddhist organization. Wikipedia

Bhakti Tirtha Swami.label: Bhakti Tirtha Swami
Bhakti Tirtha Swami.description: Bhakti Tirtha Swami, also known as Swami Krishnapada, was a leading guru and governing body commissioner of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness. He was the highest-ranking African American in ISKCON. Wikipedia

Harada Daiun Sogaku.label: Harada Daiun Sogaku
Harada Daiun Sogaku.description: Daiun Sogaku Harada Rōshi was a Sōtō Zen monk who trained under both Soto and Rinzai teachers and became known for his teaching combining methods from both schools. Wikipedia

Kamo no Yasunori.label: Kamo no Yasunori
Kamo no Yasunori.description:
Kamo no Yasunori was an onmyōji, a practitioner of onmyōdō, during the Heian period in Japan. He was considered the premier onmyōji of his time.
Yasunori was the son of the onmyōji Kamo no Tadayuki. Wikipedia

John Still.label: John Still
John Still.description: John Leonard Still is an English former footballer and the current manager of Luton Town in the Conference Premier. Wikipedia

Koun Ejō.label: Koun Ejō
Koun Ejō.description: Koun Ejō was the second patriarch of the Japanese Sōtō school of Zen Buddhism who lived during the Kamakura period. Wikipedia

Matthew F. Hale.label: Matthew F. Hale
Matthew F. Hale.description: Matthew F. Hale, more commonly known as Matt Hale, was the third Pontifex Maximus of the nontheistic and ethnocentric religion, Creativity, and the founder of the group formerly known as the World Church ... Wikipedia
Matthew F. Hale.Born: July 27, 1971 (age 42), East Peoria, Illinois, United States
Education: Southern Illinois University School of Law

Nōnin.label: Nōnin
Nōnin.description: Dainichibō Nōnin was a Japanese Buddhist monk who started the first Zen school in Japan. Wikipedia

Nikken Abe.label: Nikken Abe
Nikken Abe.description: Nikken Abe was the 67th high priest of Nichiren Shoshu, a major school of Nichiren Buddhism, and chief priest of its head temple Taisekiji in Fujinomiya, Shizuoka, Japan. Wikipedia

Omori Sogen.label: Omori Sogen
Omori Sogen.description: Ōmori Sōgen was a Japanese Rinzai Rōshi, a successor in the Tenryū-ji line of Rinzai Zen, and former president of Hanazono University, the Rinzai university in Kyoto, Japan. He became a priest in 1945. Wikipedia

Merle Kodo Boyd.label: Merle Kodo Boyd
Merle Kodo Boyd.description: Merle Kodo Boyd is the first ever African-American woman to have received Dharma transmission in Zen Buddhism, a Dharma heir of Wendy Egyoku Nakao in the White Plum Asanga. Wikipedia

Pino Puglisi.label: Pino Puglisi
Pino Puglisi.description: Giuseppe "Pino" Puglisi was a Roman Catholic priest in the rough Palermo neighbourhood of Brancaccio. He openly challenged the Mafia who controlled the neighbourhood, and was killed by them on his 56th birthday. Wikipedia

Sasaki Gensō.label: Sasaki Gensō
Sasaki Gensō.description: Sasaki Gensō is a Japanese Rinzai Rōshi, a successor in the Tenryū-ji line of Rinzai Zen, a teacher of Jikishinkage-ryū swordsmanship, and a calligrapher. Wikipedia

Tettsū Gikai.label: Tettsū Gikai
Tettsū Gikai.description: Tettsū Gikai is considered the third spiritual leader of the Sōtō Zen school of Buddhism in Japan. He began his Buddhist life as a student of the Darumashū's Ekan, but later both became students of Eihei Dōgen's newly established Sōtō school. Wikipedia

Shōkū.label: Shōkū
Shōkū.description: Shōkū, sometimes called Seizan was a disciple of Hōnen, founder of the Jōdo-shū Buddhist sect. Shōkū later succeeded another disciple of Hōnen, Jōhen as the head of a former Shingon Buddhist temple, ... Wikipedia

Tamala Krishna Goswami.label: Tamala Krishna Goswami
Tamala Krishna Goswami.description: Tamal Krishna Goswami, born as Thomas G. Herzig in New York City, NY United States served on International Society for Krishna Consciousness's Governing Body Commission since its inception in 1970. Wikipedia
Tamala Krishna Goswami.Born: June 18, 1946, Manhattan, New York City, New York, United States

William Bill.label: William Bill
William Bill.description: William Bill was Master of St Johns College, Cambridge, Vice-Chancellor of the University of Cambridge and twice Master of Trinity College, Cambridge, Provost of Eton College and Dean of Westminster. Wikipedia

George W. Webber (minister).label: George W. Webber
George W. Webber (minister).description: George William "Bill" Webber was an American Protestant minister, reverend, and social activist who served as president of the New York Theological Seminary from 1969 to 1983. Wikipedia
George W. Webber (minister).Born: May 2, 1920, Des Moines, Iowa, United States
George W. Webber (minister).Died: July 10, 2010, Maplewood, New Jersey, United States
